textBeforeTable: RCS (Revision Control System), a GNU Free Software package. TWiki is developed in a basic Linux/Apache environment. It also works with Microsoft Windows, and should have no problem on any other platform that meets the requirements. TWiki is written in Perl 5, uses a number of shell commands, and requires Server Requirements Low client and server requirements are core features that keep TWiki widely deployable, particularly across a range of browser platforms and versions. Server and client requirements for TWiki 01-Feb-2003 TWiki System Requirements TWiki Enhancement Requests TWiki Planned Features, TWiki History, TWiki Site, Related Topics: http://TWiki.org/cgi-bin/view/TWiki/TWikiDocumentation Note: Read the most up to date version of this document at Dev Flow 1998 Releases 01-Jul-1999 Release 01-Sep-1999 Release 01-May-2000 Release 01-Dec-2000 Release 01-Sep-2001 Release 01-Dec-2001 Release (Athens) 01-Feb-2003 Release (Beijing) Appendix B: TWiki Development Timeline TWiki File System Snapshot Files in twiki/templates Files under twiki/data Files under twiki/pub Files under twiki/lib Files in twiki/bin Files in twiki File Descriptions Directory Structure Who and What is This
textAfterTable: Step 1: Create & Configure the Directories NOTE: If you don't have access to your Web server configuration files - for example, if you're installing on an ISP-hosted account, or you don't have administrator privileges on your intranet server - use the alternative Step 1 instead. Create directory /home/httpd/twiki and unzip the TWiki distribution into this directory. The twiki/bin directory of TWiki must be set as a cgi-bin directory. Add /home/httpd/twiki/bin to file /etc/httpd/httpd.conf with only ExecCGI option. The twiki/pub directory of TWiki must be set so that it is visible as a URL. Add /home/httpd/twiki to file httpd.conf with normal access options (copy from /home/httpd/html ). Now add ScriptAlias for /twiki/bin and Alias for /twiki to file httpd.conf . NOTE: The ScriptAlias must come before the Alias, otherwise, Apache will fail to correctly set up /twiki/bin/, by treating it as just another subdirectory of the /twiki/ alias. The twiki/data and twiki/templates directories should be set so that they are not visible as URLs. Add them to httpd.conf with deny from all. Example httpd.conf entries:  ScriptAlias /twiki/bin/ "/home/httpd/twiki/bin/" Alias /twiki/ "/home/httpd/twiki/" <Directory "/home/httpd/twiki/bin"> Options +ExecCGI SetHandler cgi-script Allow from all </Directory> <Directory "/home/httpd/twiki/pub"> Options FollowSymLinks +Includes AllowOverride None Allow from all </Directory> <Directory "/home/httpd/twiki/data"> deny from all </Directory> <Directory "/home/httpd/twiki/templates">
